title: Software Maker Entrata  Ousts Executive Over Email  ----  By Joseph Pisani
text:
Utah software company Entrata Inc. said it ousted its chairman after he sent an anti-Semitic email to dozens of business leaders and politicians that stated false information about Covid-19 vaccines and testing.

David Bateman was asked to resign by the board hours after the Tuesday morning email was sent, according to a company spokesman. Mr. Bateman agreed to step down, effective immediately, the spokesman said.

The email had the subject line "Genocide," and falsely stated that Jewish people are behind a plot to kill Americans through the vaccine and PCR testing.

"To be absolutely clear, we at Entrata firmly condemn antisemitism in any and all forms," Chief Executive Adam Edmunds said in posts on LinkedIn and Twitter

Mr. Bateman didn't respond to requests for comment.
